title: 108_hr3525
content: The Act may be cited as the "Citizen Legislature and Political Freedom Act". Congress finds that the proliferation of campaign finance laws and government regulations have placed strict limits on contributions, hindering challengers from competing equally with incumbent politicians. Contribution limits force candidates to raise funds in small amounts, giving wealthy and long-term incumbents an unfair advantage and discouraging potential candidates from seeking office. The current campaign finance laws hinder challengers from fully discussing public policy issues and favor institutionalized special interests over grassroots and citizen activity. This regulation of political speech is undemocratic as it eliminates challengers lacking resources from political campaigns before their voices are heard. The current campaign finance laws impose burdensome reporting requirements and spending limits on political parties, giving an advantage to well-financed interest groups and wealthy individuals. The low contribution limits force contributors and activists to operate outside the system, leading to less accountability and irresponsible behavior. To promote robust discourse, free political speech, and protect constitutional freedom, all restrictions on political contributions should be lifted. The current campaign finance laws impose burdensome restrictions on political candidate and party contributions and expenditures, leading to less accountability and irresponsible behavior. To promote robust discourse and protect constitutional freedom, all restrictions on political contributions should be lifted. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to remove limitations on campaign contributions starting after 2004. Additionally, taxpayer financing of presidential election campaigns will be terminated. The taxpayer financing of presidential election campaigns will be terminated starting after 2003. The taxpayer financing of presidential election campaigns will be terminated after 2003. The provisions of this chapter will not apply to any presidential election after December 31, 2004, or to any candidate in such an election. Excess funds will be transferred to the general fund after 2004. The provisions of this chapter will not apply to any candidate in a presidential election after December 31, 2004. Clerical amendments are made to the table of sections for chapters 95 and 96 of the Code. The Federal Election Campaign Act is amended to require political committees of State or local parties to file reports with the Commission if they submit them to a State or local government entity. This amendment applies to elections after January 2005. The Federal Election Campaign Act now mandates electronic filing for all reports, requiring each person to maintain and file reports in accessible electronic form. Designations, statements, and reports are now referred to as documents, and any report or statement must be filed electronically. The Federal Election Campaign Act now requires all reports to be filed electronically, with each report being referred to as a document. The Act also mandates the placement of all reports on the internet and the use of software for filing reports. The Federal Election Campaign Act now mandates electronic filing of reports, referred to as documents, and their placement on the internet. Amendments include requiring reports for all contributions to political committees within 90 days of an election. The Federal Election Campaign Act now requires notification of contributions within 24 hours of receipt, including candidate details, contributor identification, and contribution amount. The amendment applies to reports starting from January 1, 2005. The Federal Election Campaign Act now requires notification of contributions within 24 hours of receipt, including candidate details, contributor identification, and contribution amount. An amendment waives the "best efforts" exception for information on the identification of contributors who donate over $200 in a calendar year, effective for contributions made after January 2005.
